attributes.action: Expand driving penalties to include the charge vehicular manslaughter
attributes.background: I think that the increase in dangerous, reckless and careless driving needs to be properly addressed. In the wrong hands a car is as lethal as a loaded gun. Death should be charged as vehicular manslaughter and life changing injuries as attempted vehicular manslaughter.
attributes.additional_details: Although courts now have to power to sentence those who cause death by dangerous driving to 14 years to life, this penalty is rarely, if ever used. I feel that if the charge included the term manslaughter, not only would the perception of motorists change, but judges would be more inclined to sentence those who have caused death or life changing injuries, whilst driving at excessive speed, whilst using a mobile device, under the influence of drink/drugs to an appropriate custodial sentence.

attributes.action: Life sentence for causing death by dangerous driving, including first offences
attributes.background: July 1st 2017 was the day my 17 year old brother, Stephen, was killed due to dangerous driving. The driver was on multiple drugs as well as being fuelled with alcohol. The car they had was not theirs, they had no insurance, no tax and no licence! They also seriously injured a young girl.
attributes.additional_details: The offender was not sentenced until 9 months after Stephen’s death. During this time we didn’t see the offender show any remorse. They appeared to be out partying, drinking and taking drugs. The offender was sentenced to just 8 years in prison and because they pleaded guilty, they got a third knocked off this sentence and because it was a first offence the sentence will be reduced by further third.

attributes.action: Give people accused of sexual offences anonymity until charge.
attributes.background: No one suggests names should never be released. What I believe is that there is a correct time to release names and that is not before a person is charged with an offence.

attributes.action: Make Daventry District Council (DDC) into a Unitary Authority
attributes.background: Under the proposed arrangements, decisions in the District will be taken by a council of which a majority of members represent the urban areas of Northampton. Let DDC become a unitary authority: keep democracy local.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/northamptonshire-county-council-best-value-inspection

"Sajid Javid orders probe into country council's finances" - BBC 9 January 2018

"Tory authority becomes first UK council in 20 years to impose emergency spending ban" - Daily Telegraph 3 February 2018

"Northamptonshire County Council backs £40m budget cuts" - BBC 28 February 2018

"Auditor criticises Northants County Council in damming new report" - Northants Telegraph 22 May 2018

attributes.action: Official apology to the Polish nation for UK actions at the Yalta conference
attributes.background: The apology should recognise British's abandonment of the Polish nation and 200,000 troops of the Polish Armed Forces serving under the high command of the British Army during the conference in Yalta. The UK left Poland and Poles to the grip of Soviet tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom failed to meet their diplomatic, military and moral obligations with respect to the Polish nation during the prelude to and aftermath of WWII. At Yalta, Churchill agreed that Stalin should keep the Soviet gains in Poland and that tens of thousands of veteran Polish troops under British command should lose their Kresy homes to the Soviet Union. In reaction, thirty officers and men from the II Corps committed suicide. Only 25 MPs at that time voted against Churchill plan!

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: Provide funding to Staffordshire County Council to reduce a £35 million deficit
attributes.background: Staffordshire County Council has already slashed running costs by £240 million in 9 years. There is a further forecast £35 million reduction that will see much needed services for Staffordshire people reduced or even removed. Therefore we are asking the UK Government to provide adequate funding.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are just a few of the proposed cuts: 

• School crossing patrols
• Review cost of children’s resident provision
• Review alternative autism funding
• Review of Victoria Centre of history grant 
• Removal of non-statutory community transport 
• Removal of concessionary travel before 09.30 
• Reduction in grants to voluntary community social enterprise
• Review of Adult learning disability provisions to remove preventive services
• Review remaining financial support for hate crime

attributes.action: To create awareness amongst children/teenagers about Autism/Aspergers in schools
attributes.background: I would like the government make this a small part of personal studies in schools to give children/teenagers an understanding about children living with Autism/Aspergers in social situations. It will help them to be able to recognize behavior traits and actions in order to understand.
attributes.additional_details:
A small part of the curriculum would help so many children with Autism/Aspergers be able to feel comfortable in social situations such as playing, school and parties without being judged, bullied or name called. 
Being able to integrate into social situations is key but not easy for children living with these conditions. 
Ways of communicating and showing emotion are very different from child to child but can be seen as behavior problems if not understood. 
All children deserve to happy & secure

attributes.action: Change employment law so that jobs cannot be described as full or part time
attributes.background: Currently employers advertise roles as full or part-time. Therefore automatically millions of potentially qualified people are excluded from applying. Removing this would mean applicants were selected for interview based on ability not availability in the first instance.
attributes.additional_details: Less than 10% of all jobs in the UK are advertised as open to any kind of flexibility. And yet most companies are actually set up to offer a range of flexible options. With the gig economy and technology supporting flexible working, the UK could actually be a world leader in flexible working but 90% of qualified candidates don't ever get to have the conversation with an employer because jobs are classified as Full time. The change would open a dialogue and lead to more employment.

attributes.action: Make all trespassing a criminal offence
attributes.background: There has been an uplift of illegal encampments in UK. Recently my council has had to pay out more than one hundred thousand pounds in clean up fees. Trespassers do not respond to civil rulings. To give the police more powers, I propose that all trespassing be made a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details:
People cannot dictate where they can live by simply by squatting on land they do not own. Police need powers so owners can be protected.

-100K of clean-up from Milton Keynes Council 
-Reported attacks to Police 
-Closing of School sports days https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/milton-keynes-primary-school-forced-to-cancel-sports-day-after-illegal-travellers-camp-on-field-1-8540123 
https://www.miltonkeynes.co.uk/news/illegal-travellers-camps-causing-problems-in-milton-keynes-1-8524022

attributes.action: Make housing associations subject to the freedom of information act.
attributes.background: I pay a service charge for property maintenance on my shared ownership property which is owned by a housing association. This service is contracted out to 3rd party. I recently asked for information relating to this arrangement and have been refused on the grounds that it is commercially sensitive.
attributes.additional_details: Bringing housing associations in line with the FOI act would mean that any requests for information relating to services that the residents wholly pay for, could not be refused outright and would be subject to intervention from the ICO.  This would enable more than 200,000 people to easily access information about their homes that they own in partnership with housing associations and therefore have more say in the running and the maintenance expenditure of their homes.

attributes.action: Urge Iceland to stop killing endangered whales
attributes.background: They have killed endangered Fin and Blue whales. They must stop.

attributes.action: Stop the use of Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (child spies).
attributes.background: Currently Juvenile CHIS (child spies) can be used to gather information to do with offences such as gang violence, drug offences and child sexual exploitation. They can be authorised for covert activity for up to one month which the government is trying to increase to 4 months.
attributes.additional_details: The Home office has given no numbers of how many child spies are used, how the risk assessments are carried out and whether the handlers are trained to assess juvenile mental health. The capacity for children to consent to being spies is dubious given they must feel under pressure from an authority figure (the police force) and are vulnerable in a dangerous situation. Refer to 35th Report of Session 2017-2019 of the House of Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee.

attributes.action: Allow use of Medicinal Cannabis for Fibromyalgia and CFS/ME on the NHS
attributes.background: Cannabis is currently a Class B substance, defined as a "drug that has no therapeutic value". I believe that to be untrue. Cannabis-based medicines are already available on the NHS to a select and lucky few.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that no one should have to suffer due to unjust laws and that everyone should have the right to access natural, safe, effective and inexpensive medicine. Fibromyalgia and CFS/ME sufferers have little chance of finding any medication to help their condition. There isn't one specific drug designed for treatment of symptoms. Drugs that are prescribed may have damaging side effects and some patients show little to no improvement after taking them.

attributes.action: Make school food-growing (and self-sufficiency) part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: All schools have space for growing food & with innovative techniques such as vertical gardening, even edges of a playground can become an allotment. Invest in schools so that they can REDUCE external dependency. Off-grid futures would incl. energy generation, rain-water harvesting & recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
The larger the space available, the larger the impact on education, health & school finances. It's also time to consider deleting meat from school meals, instead invest in growing fruit & veg.

Growing minds, building healthy futures, teaching valuable life-skills, helping children embrace the outdoors - growing food at school & learning about sustainability is fun, engaging & unforgettable, an essential subject for the National Curriculum.

attributes.action: Make Asthma inhalers free, like other medicines are for other ailments
attributes.background: As seen in the news people including children die from Asthma attacks.
attributes.additional_details: I know a few people and as seen on the news people of all ages are dying from Asthma attacks. Not everyone uses preventative inhalers due to the prescription costs. Why do diabetics get free prescriptions and other illnesses that can't be helped, but not asthma sufferers? This is a killer and inhalers should be free.

attributes.action: Revoke Northern Rail's Charter for disability access failures
attributes.background: Northern Rail fail in their commitments to the Equality Act by treating disabled customers less favourably than non-disabled customers.
attributes.additional_details:
They allow you to book scooter/ramp assistance and then deny access to the train when the customer arrives. This can be intimidating and humiliating them at times.

Northern Rail’s policy is outdated and their treatment of disabled people is unacceptable. The Equality Act 2010 was introduced to help ensure businesses treat everyone fairly. It protects anyone who is disabled, is thought to be disabled, or is with someone who is disabled. It gives these people rights to access goods or services in a way that means they are not treated less favourably than people without a disability

attributes.action: Get Student Finance England to consider a mortgage as ‘financial independence’.
attributes.background: Currently, the regulations for an individual applying for Student Finance under the age of 25, must be assessed on their parental household income, unless married or care for a child. However, SFE do not view a mortgage to be an eligble factor to verify “independent status”.
attributes.additional_details: After several appeals to review my circumstances, SFE have rejected my request for “independent status”. As a home-owner, unemployment with little student loan to pay my mortgage for the year whilst studying, has resulted in withdrawal from my course. It is suggested to marry to be considered as “financially independent” to therefore receive finance based on my own income rather than my parents. It is an outdated system to consider marriage as more financially independent, than owning a home.

attributes.action: Do not raise fuel duty in the Budget
attributes.background: The Chancellor has indicated he is considering raising fuel duty in the 2018 Autumn Budget. RAC Fuel Watch data shows fuel prices are at their highest for four years with drivers paying £7 more per fill-up on average than 12 months ago and £15 more than in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has the highest duty rate for diesel and the eighth highest for unleaded in the EU. Further increases would put UK drivers and businesses at a bigger disadvantage compared to our European counterparts. Motorists already contribute around £46bn in motoring related taxation each year and higher fuel prices mean the Treasury is already benefiting from extra VAT receipts on fuel costs. 

The Treasury’s own analysis in 2014 showed that lower fuel duty actually boosts economic growth which in turn yields higher revenues from other tax receipts over a long-term period.

We believe the Chancellor risks pushing further economic hardship on motorists for what is an essential item for over 40 million drivers and therefore we call on Philip Hammond to abandon any plans to raise fuel duty.

attributes.action: Force providers to supply the free to air tv channels on bedside tv sets.
attributes.background: Charging hospital patients who have no other means of entertainment, a fee for supplying free to air tv channels should be stopped. It is unfair to charge anyone to watch free to air channels.

attributes.action: Grant President Donald Trump a full State Visit
attributes.background:
Following President Trump's recent successful visit to our country, the next step should be to allow him the privilege of a full State Visit.

President Trump is the democratically elected President	& as such should be treated with the respect his position holds
attributes.additional_details: We the people of the UK request that President Trump is invited to the UK, given a full state visit, he should also be given the honour of addressing Parliament and the people of the UK.

attributes.action: Place ‘not all disabilities and illnesses are visible’ signs on disabled toilets
attributes.background: Those living with unseen disabilities and invisible illnesses can need; and have the right to use, disabled toilet facilities. Yet current signage is not inclusive, overlooks and marginalises those who need to use them, but have no outward or visible indicators of their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The current signage on disabled toilets does not represent our current understanding of hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses; by updating signage on all pre-existing, and all new build disabled toilets we can improve the quality of life for thousands of people around the U.K.  By adding this new signage alongside the pre-existing wheelchair emblem, we both include those living with hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses, and promote equality of toilet access across wider society.

attributes.action: Allow the practice of euthanasia in the UK.
attributes.background: Euthanasia should be a human right for those who need and deserve the right to die. No human being deserves to suffer from an illness with no potential for recovery. It should be a choice for all critically unwell individuals if they wish to be euthanised.
attributes.additional_details:
In dire circumstances, it should be available for UK citizens to have the choice or their families to have the choice for an ill individual to die with dignity, to end suffering for the person of ill health. 
In the UK under ASPA (Animals : Scientific Procedures Act) 1986, there is a requirement to euthanise animals in order to prevent undue suffering. If this is legally viewed as a right and a requirement for mice, rats etc. why not for humans?

attributes.action: The Government should urge the FA not to sell Wembley
attributes.background: Please help to put a stop to Wembley, a true British Iconic Landmark, being sold.

attributes.action: Put up a statue of Margaret Thatcher outside Parliament
attributes.background: Caroline Criado Perez launched an online petition in 2016 after noticing there were no statues of women outside Parliament. There is no better example of a woman than Margaret Thatcher, the first female prime minister of the UK of nearly 12 years.

attributes.action: Issue a termination notice to Bright Tribe and ALAT multi-academy trusts.
attributes.background: On the 10th of September BBC Panarama aired its findings following investigations into the set up and running of Bright Tribe and ALAT multiacademy Trust’s. Prior to this staff, parents and pupils have highlighted questionable use of related party transactions.
attributes.additional_details: Questions have been raised in the Education Select Committee relating to their conduct. They have already been removed from Whitehaven Academy.

attributes.action: After the reign of Queen Elizabeth, hold referendum on abolition of royal family
attributes.background: Too expensive to have monarch. Majority of the time monarch does not exercise powers. Feudal system outdated. Britain needs change to more modern and democratic society.
attributes.additional_details: The monarch serves no political purpose. Britain claims to be a democracy - democracy is based on equality, not class hierarchy.

attributes.action: Hold an independent inquiry Health Service settlements
attributes.background: It has been reported that Virgin Care were handed almost £2 million in an out of court settlement by Surrey’s Clinical Commissioning Groups, NHS England and Surrey County Council in 2017. This is a gross misuse of public money, but no-one has resigned or been held accountable.
attributes.additional_details: Lessons deserve to be learnt from such losses of public money.

attributes.action: Require hospitals to provide sufficient free staff parking for nurses
attributes.background: My friend, an amazing nurse, is forced to pay £24 per week to park at the hospital she works for. She only works 16hrs, yet a substantial percentage of her pay is used enabling her JUST to GO to work. Nurses are already ridiculously underpaid for their role in saving lives. How can this be fair?
attributes.additional_details: The NHS, particularly hospitals, are one of if not the busiest body of workers in the UK. Nurses work tirelessly 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to provide a service that treats over 1 million patients in just 36 hours. There is a critical shortage of nurses with 1 in 11 NHS posts currently unfilled. Nurses are important, and it makes no sense to charge them to be able to simply go into work. It’s unfair, its uneconomical, and it is clearly not helping in people staying within NHS employment.

attributes.action: Same sex unmarried/civil partnered parents to be on Childs birth certificate
attributes.background: In the UK same sex parents of donor children are unable to both go on their childs birth certificate - unless they are married/ civil partnered preconception or the child was conceived through the help of a registered fertility clinic. My son has only me on his birth certificate and it's wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Why is it ok for heterosexual couples to both be registered on birth certificate, some of these Fathers registered are not even the biological Fathers and no questions asked.

If anything were to happen to me my son would be an orphan due to no other parent having rights over him.

As a nation we have come so far with equality and rights, however the legislation and laws need to be updated to reflect this.

attributes.action: Set a legal minimum requirement for hamster cages
attributes.background: RSPCA recommend that a Syrian Hamster should have a cage with 80 x 50cm unbroken floor space. However this is not defined in law so pet shops can sell 50 x 60cm cages as LARGE hamster cages. Your small pets live stressed and unhappy lives, while you think you’ve bought a sufficient cage.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should change the law so that it specifically includes this minimum cage size for hamsters. This would make it an offence to sell and use cages for hamsters which don’t meet this size.

attributes.action: Put young offenders in prison for knife crime
attributes.background: The law for sentencing needs to be updated. People convicted of crimes involving knives should go to prison no matter what their age. They should not be allowed out on the streets if found guilty.
attributes.additional_details: There was a case recently where the defendant was under 18 and pleaded guilty to stabbing someone. There was also video evidence that the defendant had broken his court bail conditions. He just got reminded of his bail conditions - nothing else. He wasn’t sentenced to prison, even though he could have killed someone.

attributes.action: Enable an Emotional Support Animal to be recognised as an Assistance Dog.
attributes.background: In America service dogs cover both physical and mental health needs. Anxiety is a mental health condition that can cripple the people who suffer from it many of whom struggle to go outside let alone have a life that is equal to non-sufferers. Same goes for depression. So why can they not have help.
attributes.additional_details: The definition given by the government website for disability is to have a physical or mental impairment that has a substantial/long-term negative effect on ability to do normal daily activities. Anxiety, depression and other mental health illnesses fall under this and yet service dogs are not allowed. Dogs are important for people with mental health and allowing them to go everywhere with the person, like a guide dog, such as shops and restaurants allows the person to become a more active member of society.

attributes.action: Grant Tier 1 General Applicants ILR After 5 Years Continuous Legal Stay In UK
attributes.background: Tier 1 general migrants are experiencing great unfairness and inhumane treatment from the Home Office. Many have been criminalized or turned into illegal immigrants by the hostile immigration rules. With the program wrapped up on 6 April 2018, many in this category have been adversely affected.
attributes.additional_details:
Home Office base refusal decisions for leave to remain on unfair premises such as failing genuine income test even when tax has been paid on such income or citing minor tax errors. Most of these decisions cannot be subject to reasonable challenge due to the black letter law of the Point Based System introduced in 2014 that implicitly confers absolute power on decision makers.

Tier 1 migrants took legal route offered by the UK in migrating here, it is morally unfair to deny them their rights.

attributes.action: UK Government should urge India to stop mob lynching and crime against women.
attributes.background: UK Government should ask India to stop mob lynching and stop crime against women in India and take action against Saffron Terrorists who are killing minorities including Muslims and Christians.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government should ask United Nations Commission on Human Rights to take notice of what is happening in India.

86% of those killed in cow-related violence since 2010 are Muslim, 97% attacks after Modi govt came to power-https://m.hindustantimes.com/india-news/86-killed-in-cow-related-violence-since-2010-are-muslims-97-attacks-after-modi-govt-came-to-power/story-w9CYOksvgk9joGSSaXgp”

attributes.action: Allow the rules of intestacy to be challenged when evidence allows
attributes.background: Allow the rules of intestacy to be challenged where there is evidence that the deceased wishes for their estate to be distributed another way
attributes.additional_details: The rules of intestacy are severely outdated and do not allow for the complex families we have nowadays. They allow for people to inherit when this isn't what the deceased would have wanted or when all evidence points to another method of distribution. The rules should not be as black and white as they are at present.There should be an allowance for people to challenge the rules when necessary.

attributes.action: Change the law for protection for Police Service Animals
attributes.background: The current MAXIMUM sentence for injuring a Police Service Animal is 6 months, but it is usually just a fine. Help to change the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to carry a heavier sentence and to take all Police Service Animals into consideration.

attributes.action: Allow parents to claim carers allowance for more than one child who receive DLA
attributes.background: I am a mother of 2 disabled children. They both are in reciept of high rate DLA and mobility. Therefore I claim carers allowance of £64.60 a week which is way below the national minimum wage. One of my children has various complex medical neeeds and is a full on 24/7 365 days a week nursing role.
attributes.additional_details: As parents and full time carers to our children, most of us can not work due to the complex nature of our children’s medical needs. Therefore I am calling on our government to enable us full time parent carers of more than one disabled child to be able to claim the £64.60 per week for each of our children who are in receipt of DLA and not just one.

attributes.action: Workplace Stress&mental health training made mandatory for all managers
attributes.background: Since 2012 work related stress, anxiety & depression has increased from 10.4 million to 12.5 million days lost. Employee, work related mental ill health is taking it's toll on workplaces, but also effecting people's home lives, more often than not alcohol and substance misuse problems, & suicide.
attributes.additional_details: HSEAW states  "Employers have a legal duty to protect employees from stress at work by doing a risk assessment and acting on it." However, as a company who specialise in corporate Mental Health and Workplace Wellbeing programmes the vast majority of organisations we come across are not complying with legislation as legislation is not being enforced, stress Ps & Ps are not in place & managers, HR and H&S have had no training to aid in prevention & appropriate management of these risks.

attributes.action: Male Suicide Prevention Strategy
attributes.background: According to the ONS, "of the 5,965 suicides registered in 2016, a total of 4,508 were male and 1,457 were female." We call on HM Government to take urgent and meaningful action to identify main factors that contribute to men in the UK being three times more likely to commit suicide than women.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the PM to establish a panel on Male Suicide Prevention, whose job would be to undertake public consultation and produce a comprehensive report on male suicide in the UK; with key findings and recommendations leading to the publication of the Government's first ever UK-wide Male Suicide Prevention Strategy.

"The fall in suicide rates from 2015 to 2016 is the largest decrease in 20 years. It fell for both males and females in the UK, although men still account for 3/4 of all suicides."

attributes.action: Provide funding for Amputee Football in the UK.
attributes.background: The England Amputee Football Association's aim is to provide all amputees, people with congenital limb deficiencies and persons with restricted use of limbs, with the opportunity to play football locally, nationally and internationally. However, players must raise funds to cover the costs of this.
attributes.additional_details: Amputee football is a fascinating sport to watch. My husband, Darren has been an amputee for 10 years and by being part of a team of amazing and inspirational people, as well as the volunteers who provide physio and coaching, means that he can respresent his country playing the sport that he’s always loved. All players must fundraise and donate to the charity in order to be able to participate in training and tournaments. This sport has the potential to be one of the best in the UK.

attributes.action: Change adultery for grounds of divorce to apply to same-sex affairs
attributes.background: According to current UK law, you cannot divorce someone on grounds of adultery if it's a same-sex affair. This technically means that you don't legally commit adultery if you cheat on your partner with someone of the same sex- even if you are in a same-sex marriage. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: In order for heterosexual and homosexual couples to have completely equal rights, the UK law needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Set up a Select Committee for Adults with Learning Disabilities.
attributes.background: The working practice of services regarding adults with learning disabilities need investigating root to branch inside and out by a specially appointed Select Committee.
attributes.additional_details: Not fit for purpose the Parliamentary Health & Social Care Ombudsman,  Local Government Ombudsman, UNISON and others fail to provide a service and/or adequate standard of service to deal with Adults with Learning  Disabilities.

attributes.action: Add ethnic groups Gypsies, Roma and Irish Travellers to the NHS data dictionary
attributes.background:
Gypsies, Roma and Irish Travellers are ethnic groups with some of the lowest health outcomes in the UK.

At present, these groups are not recorded in the NHS data dictionary. Inclusion in the NHS data dictionary would give a clearer idea to authorities on how to tackle these health inequalities.
attributes.additional_details:
Gypsies and Travellers have a life expectancy of over 10% less than the general population (10-12 years). Other health issues include such as high infant mortality rates, high maternal mortality rates are also seen to be prevalent in the Gypsy and Traveller communities. 

Furthermore, the European Commission sees similar health inequalities with Roma; “a high prevalence of diabetes, cardiovascular disease...obesity, asthma and mental health issues such as stress, anxiety and depression”

attributes.action: Emancipation Day Bank Holiday.... First Monday in August
attributes.background: The emancipation of slavery which took place in August 1833 is celebrated across different parts of the world. Britain, who played a big part in the slave trade, but,consequently played its’ part in the emancipation of slavery has never recognised this day as an important event in our history.
attributes.additional_details:
The slave trade lasted for centuries and resulted in millions of people losing their lives. A vast amount losing their lives in horrific circumstances. Britain made vast amount of money during the slave trade and many establishments in Britain was built on the back of it.
The emancipation has left us with great people that have played a major part in the human rights campaign such as Nelson Mandela, Dr  Martin Luther King, Rosa Parks. But we also have to remember that these people wouldn’t have the voice to speak if it wasn’t for emancipation.
By having Emancipation day as a bank holiday it will make the people of  Britain more aware and understand our past history.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to cut grass verges at night-time as it kills nocturnal wildlife
attributes.background: The Council have started to cut grass verges at night-time. This is disastrous for nocturnal wildlife eg hedgehog's, vole's etc as they come out onto the grass verges to feed and travel and are too slow to avoid the mower blades. These animals need protecting and it should be done during the day.

attributes.action: Make flu jabs free for teachers
attributes.background: Flu jabs are free for a range of different people, teachers come into contact with a large number of people including children and parents. Schools often have flu outbreaks and teachers end up having to take time off due to sickness. This could be prevented if flu jabs were provided.

attributes.action: UK Government to be responsible for planning that affects historic environment
attributes.background: Local councils do not have the necessary expertise to make planning decisions when the historic environment is at stake. The UK Government should take back responsibility for these decisions from local councils, to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NPPF fails to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites. Planners lack the wisdom to appreciate them. These problems are far-reaching and threaten the destruction of our historic environment as well as the squandering of tax payers’ money.

attributes.action: Ban Animal circuses in the UK. It is animal cruelty and completely barbaric.
attributes.background: I am tired of seeing endless videos and stories all over the internet and news of animals being killed or showing signs of such unnatural distress simply for our entertainment. As humans and as a community it is our duty to keep moving forward from senseless, unnecessary and straight up callous acts

attributes.action: Change the law to make it illegal to use fox cage traps in an urban area.
attributes.background: Foxes are being caught in cage traps in a built up residential area where many cats roam free, clearly creating a welfare issue of any animals caught in the trap. It seems the law is morally outdated and needs to be amended to make it illegal to use this kind of device commercially.
attributes.additional_details: Foxes can live in harmony in an urban area. Living next to a business that has recently admitted to legally capturing foxes and releasing them nearby, potentially leaving Cubs to perish. Local cats could also get trapped at any time. This distressed many people on a Facebook post, clearly the current law does not address animal welfare needs or society's current view on trapping foxes, alternative deterrent methods could be used avoiding moving foxes from their environment to protect income.
